titleStmt.title: J. G. Morrison and S. F. Gano to Unknown
CWG7769

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: There are two vacancies on the Bench of the Scott County Court, one in the Oxford District ^No 7^ caused by the Death of Joseph E. Gregg, and one in the White Sulpher District ^No. 2^ caused by the Esqr Josephus Dehoney having I joined the Rebel Army and left the State See Acts of the Legislature passed in Dec 1861 page -- 52. We would respectfully recommend the appointment by your Excellency of Joel Ammerman in the Oxford District, and of the appointment of Bennet Branham in the White Sulpher District, both of whom are good and Loyal men. and that the appointments be made this week, and Commissions forward by Friday next, in order that the Appointees may be notified before Monday next Nov 3d to assist in allowing the County claims &C &C

Very Respectfully
J. G. Morrison
S. F. Gano

Scott Co
J. P.
Dist No 2 & 7
Appd made Octo 30. 1862
